title: 820-00850 (A1989) - Booting successfull - Left USB-C ports issue
message:
Hi,

I have here an A1989 where the left USB-C ports are not recogizing any peripherals - charging is working - right side no issues.

Could it be that the THB IC is damaged or corroded? (Should I reflow the IC?)

Note: The MacBook was water damaged in that area, [MEDIA=imgur]a/mmiaETv[/MEDIA] (U3200 was bad)

title: 820-00850 (A1989) - Booting successfull - Left USB-C ports issue
message:
Left side USB devices are powered from L3500.
Do you get voltage there?
Test connecting an USB device, of course.

title: 820-00850 (A1989) - Booting successfull - Left USB-C ports issue
message:
No voltage on L3500 (P5VUSBC_X_LL / P5VUSBC_X_R) - USB device is plugged in.
5.2V on LB700 (P5VUSBC_T_LL / P5VUSBC_T_R) - USB device is plugged in.

Note: U3500 is getting 5.2V on PP5V_USBC_X_VCC, so maybe U3500 is bad?

title: 820-00850 (A1989) - Booting successfull - Left USB-C ports issue
message:
LB700 is for right USB ports!
Did you check L3500 connecting an USB device on left side!

These chips fail a lot.
U3500 gets 5V on both 19 & 20 pins?

title: 820-00850 (A1989) - Booting successfull - Left USB-C ports issue
message:
Yes 5.2V on both pins.

I have removed L3500 and found a short on PP5V_S4_X_USBC, removed the CD3215 ... short is still present.

title: 820-00850 (A1989) - Booting successfull - Left USB-C ports issue
message:
You can inject voltage to find the culprit.
Should be one of the filter caps, near R3530; if you already removed both U3100/200.

title: 820-00850 (A1989) - Booting successfull - Left USB-C ports issue
